title: Can I write a book about characters from other books? - Quora

response.answer_text: How old are these books? Because here’s the problem. If the books are out of copyright, you can do anything you want. Pride and Prejudice and Zombies? It’s been done. If the books are still copyrighted, you need a contract with the right holders if you want to publish and make money off it. Or, you can write it and share it on a fanfiction website, like Archive of Our Own or FanFiction, but definitely without earnings. Double check your nation’s rules, though - Netflix got in trouble because they thought Sherlock Holmes was public domain…and in many places he is, and even in USA (mostly), but his latest stories aren’t, so they got sued for using “character development” from these stories.

Sure. It has been done, for example with Jasper Fforde’s The Eyre Affair. The Eyre Affair - Wikipedia His characters were out of copyright. Not sure if that makes a difference. There are numerous James Bond and Sherlock Holmes books by other authors. You may need permission from the estate to write in the style of the original rather than to use them as incidental characters.

Yes, if those books are so old they’re in public domain, which means that their copyright has lapsed. So you can write about Ebenezer Scrooge or Madame Bovary or Tom Sawyer, but not about Jack Reacher or Luke Skywalker.

THAT, my friend, is called a fan fiction, and they’re actually quite a common thing to write. You can’t have them officially published but there are platforms like Wattpad that you can use to get your work out into the world. -Bubbly
Yes, you can write a book ABOUT characters from other books. What you CAN'T do is to use those characters in your book.
